subject_as_recorded: Nasafī, ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad, -1310. Manār al-anwār|Islamic law--Interpretation and construction|Hanafites|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
physical_description: Extent: 205, i leaves: paper ; 265 x 183 (188 x 135) mm. bound to 266 x 205 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 3a).|25 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Ḥāshiyah on the margins. Fol. 3 is pasted on the next folio. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals (first fly-leaves with inscriptions are counted fol. 1-3). Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Uṣūl thānī 55".|Copy completed on Friday 29 Jumādá al-Awwal 737 [January 3, 1337]. Copy of the mamlūk Āqbughābākī Ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Malikī al-Nāṣīrī (colophon, fol. 205a).|Collation: Paper, fol. ii, 203, i ; iii (fly-leaves, with inscriptions ; fol. iii is pasted on the first fol. of the first quire) + 110 2-1910 2010 (+2, fol. 194 and 205 + i ; catchword on the verso of each leaf, except central bifolio of each quire ; the quires are numbered using Arabic ordinals, in the form "thānī" (see fol. 14a).|Two ownership statements, one signed ʻUthmān Hadī ibn Muṣṭafá (fol. 1a), the other signed Nūḥādīʹzādah(?), with seal reading "al-Sayyid Aḥmad Nūrī" (fol. 3a). Seal on fol. 204a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

subject_as_recorded: Islamic law--Interpretation and construction--Early works to 1800|Hanafites|Islam--Doctrines--Early works to 1800|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
author_as_recorded: Bazdawī, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad, 1009 or 1010-1089 or 1090
physical_description: Extent: i, 169, i leaves: paper ; 250 x 170 mm. bound to 251 x 180 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title supplied by cataloger. The name of the author appears at the beginning of the text.|Written in medium small naskh in black ink, with 15 lines per page (written surface: 128 x 85 mm.) in the beginning of the ms., and 21 lines per page (written surface: 166 x 108 mm.) for the second part. Dark cream paper with laid and chain lines visible. Important marginalia. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Uṣūl 7". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 504".|Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

subject_as_recorded: Islamic law--Interpretation and construction--Early works to 1800|Hanafites|Islam--Doctrines--Early works to 1800|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton|Droit islamique--Interprétation--Ouvrages avant 1800|Hanafites|Manuscrits arabes--New Jersey--Princeton|Hanafites|Islam--Doctrines|Islamic law--Interpretation and construction|Manuscripts, Arabic|New Jersey--Princeton
author_as_recorded: Bazdawī, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad, 1009 or 1010-1089 or 1090
physical_description: Extent: 232, i leaves: paper ; 249 x 160 (150 x 85) mm. bound to 250 x 175 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from note on fol. 1a in the same hand as the ownership statement signed Aḥmad Nūrī.|17 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Light cream paper with laid lines visible. Fol. 1 consists of a later addition pasted on the recto of the first original fol. Marginal and interlinear annotations and commentary, apparently by the same hand as the main text. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Uṣūl thānī 34". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 77".|Copy completed on a Wednesday of Jumādá al-Ākhir 768, by ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Marghānī|From the books of al-Sayyid Aḥmad Nūrī al-Shādhilī al----?, known as Nūqādīʹzādah(?) (ownership statement on fol. 1a, dated 16 J[umādá?] 1117 [1705], with seal reading "al-Sayyid Aḥmad Nūrī"). Obliterated large seal on fol. 1a (repeated on fol. 227a, 232b). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

subject_as_recorded: Islamic law--Interpretation and construction--Early works to 1800|Hanafites|Islam--Doctrines--Early works to 1800|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
author_as_recorded: Bazdawī, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad, 1009 or 1010-1089 or 1090
physical_description: Extent: 290 leaves: paper ; 218 x 160 (131 x 82) mm. bound to 220 x 167 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from note on fol. 1a.|15 lines per page. Written in clear medium small naskh in black ink with use of red for overlining and reinking, and larger script for headings. Light cream paper with laid and chain lines visible. Ḥāshiyah on the margins of some fol. (see fol. 2b-3a; 74a-119b). Table of contents on fol. 2a-b. Biographical note on the author on fol. 3a. Inscription in Arabic script in red pencil on fol. 1a: "S raqm 65".|Copy completed on 12 Shaʻbān 787 [Sept. 18, 1385] (colophon, fol. 289b).|Two ownership statements on fol. 289b, signed Shaykh Ḥasan ibn JLB Darwīsh, and Muṣṭafá ibn Maḥmūd al-Qāḍī bi-madīnat Izmīr. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

subject_as_recorded: Islamic law--Interpretation and construction--Early works to 1800|Hanafites|Islam--Doctrines--Early works to 1800|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
author_as_recorded: Bazdawī, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad, 1009 or 1010-1089 or 1090
physical_description: Extent: i, 286, i leaves: paper ; 193 x 165 (100 x 93) mm. bound to 200 x 175 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from lower edge of the text block.|13 lines per page. Written in clear medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Dark thick paper with pulp and chain lines visible. Important marginalia, with ḥāshiyah and short excerpts of other works. These continue after the end of the text on fol. 285b-286b (including a ṣalāt al-Ḥājah on fol. 285b). Fol i is a later addition on glazed european paper, with a grid in red ink on the verso. Kabīkaj, verses of poetry in Persian, inscriptions and short texts on fol. 1a. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Uṣūl 3" (repeated in pink pencil on the pastedown of the upper cover). Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 199".|From the books of Aḥmad Najīb ibn Aḥmad Ṭāhir (ownership statement on fol. 1a). Seal on fol. 286a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
